availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, merchant. London, England native. Son of John Cox and Mary Cowell Cox. Married to Ann Hopkinson Cox in Lexington, Kentucky, on April 10, 1819. Father of Alice Ann Cox, Caroline Cox, William H. Cox, Lissant Cox, Lucy Maria Cox, Joseph H. Cox, Horatio M. Cox, and Albert G. Cox. Married to Mary Caroline Dimmitt Cox in Mason County on November 12, 1854. Learned the merchant trade with his father in Mr. Marsh's hosiery shop in London from 1800 to 1817. Merchant in Maysville from 1819. Merchant with William H. Cox as George Cox & Son in Maysville in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Maysville in 1850. Merchant in Maysville in 1860. Employed his son, Lissant Cox, as a clerk in Maysville in 1860.
